storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view a history log of scheduling conflicts to analyze and improve scheduling practices

testCases.title: Verify conflict history retrieval with filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict history database contains at least 20 conflict records
Conflicts exist for multiple date ranges and resources
User has authorization to access conflict history

steps.action: Navigate to conflict history page by clicking on 'Conflict History' menu item
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history page loads successfully displaying empty filter form with fields for date range, resource, and conflict type. Default view shows paginated list of all conflicts

steps.action: Select start date as '01/01/2024' and end date as '01/31/2024' in date range filter
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter accepts the input and displays selected dates

steps.action: Select a specific resource 'Conference Room A' from resource dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Resource filter displays selected resource

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes filters and displays filtered conflict records. Loading indicator appears during processing

steps.action: Review the displayed conflict records in the results table
steps.expectedResult: Only conflicts matching the filter criteria are shown: conflicts between 01/01/2024 and 01/31/2024 for Conference Room A. Each record displays conflict ID, date, resource, type, and status

steps.action: Verify each displayed record's date falls within selected range and resource matches filter
steps.expectedResult: All displayed records have dates between 01/01/2024 and 01/31/2024 and resource is 'Conference Room A'. No records outside filter criteria are shown

postconditions: Filtered conflict records remain displayed on screen
Filter selections remain active and visible
User can apply additional filters or clear existing ones
System maintains filter state for current session

testCases.title: Validate export functionality for conflict history
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict history page is accessible
At least 10 conflict records exist in the database
User has export permissions enabled
Browser allows file downloads

steps.action: Navigate to conflict history page
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history page loads with list of all conflicts and filter options visible

steps.action: Apply date range filter from '01/01/2024' to '01/15/2024'
steps.expectedResult: Date filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Select conflict type 'Resource Double Booking' from type filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Type filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results are displayed showing only conflicts matching date range and type criteria. Record count is visible

steps.action: Click 'Export to CSV' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file download initiates immediately. File name follows format 'conflict_history_YYYYMMDD.csv'. Download progress is visible

steps.action: Open downloaded CSV file in spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains all filtered conflict records with columns: Conflict ID, Date, Time, Resource, Type, Status, Description. Data matches what was displayed on screen

steps.action: Return to conflict history page and click 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file download initiates. File name follows format 'conflict_history_YYYYMMDD.pdf'. Download progress is visible

steps.action: Open downloaded PDF file in PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully with professional formatting. Contains header with export date, filtered conflict records in table format with all relevant columns, and footer with page numbers. Data matches filtered results

postconditions: Two files are downloaded: CSV and PDF formats
Both files contain identical filtered data
Original filtered view remains unchanged on screen
Export action is logged in system audit trail
Files are saved to user's default download location

testCases.title: Ensure access control for conflict history
preconditions: Test user account exists without Scheduler role or conflict history permissions
Conflict history feature is enabled in the system
Access control rules are configured properly
User is logged into the system with unauthorized account

steps.action: Log in to the system using unauthorized user credentials (user without Scheduler role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs into the system with limited permissions

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to conflict history page by entering URL '/conflicts/history' directly in browser
steps.expectedResult: System blocks access and redirects to error page or dashboard

steps.action: Verify error message displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Clear error message is displayed: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view conflict history. Please contact your administrator.' HTTP 403 Forbidden status is returned

steps.action: Check main navigation menu for conflict history option
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history menu item is not visible or is disabled/grayed out for unauthorized user

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict history API endpoint directly using GET /conflicts/history
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden error with JSON response containing error message about insufficient permissions

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains unable to access conflict history
Access attempt is logged in security audit log
User session remains active but restricted
No conflict data is exposed to unauthorized user
System security integrity is maintained

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to log all detected conflicts for audit and compliance purposes

testCases.title: Verify all conflicts are logged with metadata
preconditions: Conflict detection engine is running and operational
Logging service is active and connected to database
Test scheduling data exists with potential conflicts
User has access to query log database
System time is synchronized correctly

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by attempting to book 'Conference Room A' for two different meetings at the same time slot (2:00 PM - 3:00 PM on 02/15/2024)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and displays conflict alert to user. Conflict detection engine triggers immediately

steps.action: Note the conflict ID and timestamp displayed in the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert shows unique conflict ID (e.g., CONF-2024-001234) and timestamp of detection

steps.action: Access the logging database using authorized query tool or admin interface
steps.expectedResult: Successfully connected to logging database with read permissions

steps.action: Query logs for the conflict entry using conflict ID: SELECT * FROM conflict_logs WHERE conflict_id = 'CONF-2024-001234'
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is retrieved successfully from database

steps.action: Verify log entry contains all required metadata fields
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains: conflict_id, timestamp, conflict_type (Resource Double Booking), resource_id (Conference Room A), affected_bookings (both booking IDs), severity_level, detection_method, system_version, user_id_initiator, and conflict_description

steps.action: Validate timestamp accuracy by comparing log timestamp with conflict detection time
steps.expectedResult: Log timestamp matches conflict detection time within 1 second accuracy

steps.action: Verify all metadata values are accurate and complete
steps.expectedResult: All metadata fields contain correct, non-null values matching the actual conflict scenario. Resource ID, booking IDs, and user information are accurate

postconditions: Conflict is permanently logged in database
Log entry is immutable and timestamped
Conflict remains in detected state until resolved
Log is available for future audit queries
System continues monitoring for new conflicts

testCases.title: Validate user action logging on conflicts
preconditions: Active scheduling conflict exists in the system
Conflict alert is displayed to user
User is logged in with Scheduler role
Logging service is operational
User action tracking is enabled

steps.action: Locate an active conflict alert displayed on the dashboard showing conflict ID 'CONF-2024-001235'
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is visible with options to 'Acknowledge' or 'Dismiss' the conflict

steps.action: Click 'Acknowledge' button on the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: System processes acknowledgment. Conflict status changes to 'Acknowledged'. Confirmation message appears: 'Conflict acknowledged successfully'

steps.action: Access logging database and query for user action: SELECT * FROM conflict_logs WHERE conflict_id = 'CONF-2024-001235' AND action_type = 'ACKNOWLEDGE'
steps.expectedResult: Log entry for acknowledgment action is retrieved

steps.action: Verify log entry contains user action details
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes: conflict_id, action_type (ACKNOWLEDGE), user_id, username, action_timestamp, previous_status, new_status (Acknowledged), ip_address, and session_id

steps.action: Create another conflict and click 'Dismiss' button on the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is dismissed. Status changes to 'Dismissed'. Confirmation message appears

steps.action: Query logs for dismiss action on the new conflict
steps.expectedResult: Log entry for dismiss action is found with action_type 'DISMISS' and all required metadata including user information and timestamp

steps.action: Verify chronological order of logged actions
steps.expectedResult: All user actions are logged in correct chronological sequence with accurate timestamps showing progression of conflict handling

postconditions: All user actions are permanently recorded in logs
Audit trail is complete and traceable
Conflict status reflects latest user action
Logs maintain data integrity
User action history is available for compliance review

testCases.title: Ensure logs are securely stored and retrievable
preconditions: Conflict logs exist in the database
Encryption is enabled for log storage
Authorized user credentials are available
Unauthorized test user account exists
Audit access interface is configured

steps.action: Log in to the system using authorized auditor credentials with log access permissions
steps.expectedResult: Successfully authenticated and logged into system with auditor role

steps.action: Navigate to audit log access interface or admin panel
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully showing log query options

steps.action: Execute query to retrieve conflict logs from the past 30 days: SELECT * FROM conflict_logs WHERE log_date >= CURRENT_DATE - 30
steps.expectedResult: Query executes successfully and returns list of conflict log entries

steps.action: Verify data integrity by checking log entry completeness and format
steps.expectedResult: All log entries are intact with complete data fields. No corruption or missing data detected. Timestamps are sequential and logical

steps.action: Verify encryption status by checking database storage configuration
steps.expectedResult: Logs are stored with encryption enabled. Encryption algorithm (e.g., AES-256) is confirmed. Encrypted fields include sensitive data like user information and conflict details

steps.action: Export a sample of logs to verify data is decrypted properly for authorized access
steps.expectedResult: Exported logs are readable and properly decrypted. All data fields are accessible and in correct format

steps.action: Log out and log in using unauthorized user credentials without audit access permissions
steps.expectedResult: Successfully logged in as unauthorized user with limited permissions

steps.action: Attempt to access audit log interface or query conflict logs directly
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. Error message displayed: 'Access Denied: Insufficient permissions to view audit logs.' HTTP 403 Forbidden status returned

steps.action: Attempt to access log database directly using unauthorized credentials
steps.expectedResult: Database connection is refused or authentication fails. No log data is accessible. Security event is logged

steps.action: Verify unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Security log contains entry for unauthorized access attempt with user ID, timestamp, attempted resource, and denial reason

postconditions: Authorized users can access logs successfully
Unauthorized access attempts are blocked and logged
Log data integrity is maintained
Encryption remains active on stored logs
Audit trail includes both successful and failed access attempts
System security posture is verified and intact

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to provide suggestions for alternative scheduling options when conflicts occur to facilitate quick resolution

testCases.title: Validate generation of alternative scheduling suggestions
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one appointment exists in the system
Multiple resources are available in the system
Scheduling UI is accessible
Resource availability data is up to date

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling interface loads successfully with calendar view

steps.action: Attempt to schedule an appointment that conflicts with an existing appointment (same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and displays a conflict notification

steps.action: Trigger the alternative suggestions feature by clicking on 'View Alternatives' or similar option
steps.expectedResult: Alternative scheduling suggestions are automatically generated and displayed

steps.action: Review the suggestions displayed in the UI
steps.expectedResult: Suggestions are clearly displayed showing available time slots with corresponding available resources, including date, time, and resource name

steps.action: Select one of the suggested alternative time slots from the list
steps.expectedResult: Selected suggestion is highlighted and a confirmation or apply button becomes active

steps.action: Click the apply or confirm button to apply the selected suggestion
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is successfully updated with the new time slot and resource, conflict is resolved, and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the updated appointment in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Appointment appears in the calendar at the new time slot with the assigned resource, no conflict indicators are present

postconditions: Appointment is successfully rescheduled without conflicts
Original conflicting time slot remains occupied by the existing appointment
New time slot is now occupied by the rescheduled appointment
System logs the rescheduling action
Resource availability is updated in the system

testCases.title: Verify suggestion generation latency under 2 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
System has normal load conditions
Multiple resources and appointments exist in the database
Timing measurement tool or browser developer tools are available
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor API response times
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to capture network activity

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling interface loads successfully

steps.action: Attempt to create an appointment that will trigger a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system

steps.action: Note the timestamp when requesting alternative suggestions and trigger the suggestion generation
steps.expectedResult: Request is sent to GET /scheduling/alternatives API endpoint, timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Monitor the Network tab for the API response time
steps.expectedResult: API response is received and displayed in the Network tab with timing information

steps.action: Verify the total time from request initiation to suggestions appearing in the UI
steps.expectedResult: Alternative suggestions appear in the UI within 2 seconds of the request, API response time is under 2 seconds as shown in developer tools

steps.action: Repeat the test 3 more times with different conflict scenarios to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: All iterations complete suggestion generation within 2 seconds

postconditions: Performance metrics are documented
System meets the 2-second latency requirement
No performance degradation is observed
Test results are logged for reporting

testCases.title: Ensure suggestions reflect current resource availability
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Multiple resources exist in the system with known schedules
Some resources have appointments scheduled, others are available
Resource availability data is current and accurate
Access to view resource schedules independently is available

steps.action: Open the resource management view and document the current availability of all resources including their scheduled appointments
steps.expectedResult: Resource schedules are visible showing occupied and available time slots for each resource

steps.action: Identify specific time slots where certain resources are already booked
steps.expectedResult: Booked time slots and resources are clearly identified and documented

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and attempt to create an appointment that triggers a conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected and conflict notification appears

steps.action: Request alternative scheduling suggestions
steps.expectedResult: System generates and displays alternative suggestions

steps.action: Review each suggested time slot and resource combination
steps.expectedResult: All suggestions display specific time slots with assigned resources

steps.action: Cross-reference each suggested resource and time slot against the documented resource schedules from step 1
steps.expectedResult: All suggested resources are confirmed to be available during the suggested time slots, no suggestions include resources that are already booked

steps.action: Verify that resources with known conflicts during suggested times are NOT included in the suggestions
steps.expectedResult: Suggestions exclude any resources that have existing appointments during the suggested time slots

steps.action: Check that the suggestions only include time slots within valid scheduling hours and resource working hours
steps.expectedResult: All suggested time slots fall within appropriate business hours and resource availability windows

postconditions: All suggestions are verified to reflect accurate resource availability
No double-booking scenarios are present in suggestions
Resource schedule integrity is maintained
Test validation results are documented
